post_text: A huge thank you to the Hebron Public Schools PTA for all their support as we reopened schools! The water bottles will come in handy and the kids love the lanyards!
shared_text:
Hebron Public Schools PTA
September 8 at 7:50 AM ¬∑

Happy first day of school to everyone starting today and those starting later this week! There are some fun surprises from the PTA. All students will be receiving a lanyard to keep their mask from getting lost. And there are also water bottles in all classrooms so no one will ever be thirsty if they forget their water bottles at home. Have a great day and let's make 2020-2021 a great year! ‚úè üö∏ üñç
text:
A huge thank you to the Hebron Public Schools PTA for all their support as we reopened schools! The water bottles will come in handy and the kids love the lanyards!

Hebron Public Schools PTA
September 8 at 7:50 AM ¬∑

Happy first day of school to everyone starting today and those starting later this week! There are some fun surprises from the PTA. All students will be receiving a lanyard to keep their mask from getting lost. And there are also water bottles in all classrooms so no one will ever be thirsty if they forget their water bottles at home. Have a great day and let's make 2020-2021 a great year! ‚úè üö∏ üñç

post_text:
Please note we have updated the location of our meeting tonight: The Board of Education has elected to meet in person as well as virtually. If attending in person, please be advised that due to Governor Lamont's Executive Order No. 7ZZ, the capacity of the room cannot exceed 25 people including Board of Education Members, Administration, Staff and Members of the Public. Anyone attending in person is required to follow mandated masking guidelines per Executive Order No. 7BB. Due to the restriction, the public is encouraged to attend via Zoom if able to allow for all community members who wish to participate to do so.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MEpbaoRVC7xbJLevs54kPtLD0kHK5veQ/view?usp=sharing
text:
Please note we have updated the location of our meeting tonight: The Board of Education has elected to meet in person as well as virtually. If attending in person, please be advised that due to Governor Lamont's Executive Order No. 7ZZ, the capacity of the room cannot exceed 25 people including Board of Education Members, Administration, Staff and Members of the Public. Anyone attending in person is required to follow mandated masking guidelines per Executive Order No. 7BB. Due to the restriction, the public is encouraged to attend via Zoom if able to allow for all community members who wish to participate to do so.

post_text: Our Board of Education will hold a Special Meeting tomorrow night at 6:30 to discuss and consider action regarding our ReEntry Plan. While we would prefer to have this meeting in person, we recognize we are likely to have a large public audience. Currently, our meetings are limited to no more than 25 participants under an executive order from Governor Lamont. In the interest of transparency and to encourage more public participation, we will conduct our meeting using Zoom. Please find meeting details in the agenda below and the enclosures are posted on our website under Board of Education - BOE Packet - 2020 - 2020-7-22. Please continue to use ReEntry@Hebron.k12.ct.us to send us feedback and comments rather than commenting directly on Facebook. Thanks! üòÄhttps://drive.google.com/file/d/10Jy8CUQLaigg4thAOo9CLW49YgqWQDrE/view?usp=sharing

post_text: Andover Hebron Marlborough Youth Services has been nominated for a Red Sox's IMPACT Award! As I am sure you know, HPS works closely with AHM. We are so proud of their nomination and would encourage families and community members to vote for them. If they win, they will receive a $10,000 grant to support local mental health initiatives! Way to go AHM for being nominated for this award!
shared_text:
MLB.COM
The IMPACT Awards Nomination Form
text:
Andover Hebron Marlborough Youth Services has been nominated for a Red Sox's IMPACT Award! As I am sure you know, HPS works closely with AHM. We are so proud of their nomination and would encourage families and community members to vote for them. If they win, they will receive a $10,000 grant to support local mental health initiatives! Way to go AHM for being nominated for this award!

The IMPACT Awards Nomination Form

post_text: We just finished our parade through town. We started at 2 and wrapped up at 7:55. It took longer than we thought but we hung in there and finished strong. It was great to see everyone cheering us on. It meant so much. A huge thanks to the police and fire crews that made today safe and fun. A huge thanks to our staff for putting the event together. A huge thanks to the families! #HebronROCKS

Monday the 18th - pick up for 2 days
Wednesday the 20th - pick up for 3 days
Friday the 22nd - pick up for 4 days
Monday the 25th - OFF - Memorial Day
Wednesday the 27th - normal distribution resumes

post_text: The Hebron Board of Finance passed our 20-21 school year budget.
shared_text:
Heather Petit
May 13 at 8:31 PM ¬∑

Very pleased to announce that the Hebron Board of Education budget was passed tonight in its entirety by the Board of Finance. We are thankful for their dedication and support of not only the education budget, but of our schools, teachers and staff, and most importantly, our children. A huge thank you to the many community members who voiced their support as well. #hebronrocks

post_text: Help spread the word about the state‚Äôs new ‚ÄúTalk It Out Line‚Äù, which is a Department of Children and Families‚Äô initiative created to provide support and services to help parents and caretakers with the stress and increased needs resulting from caring for their children during the COVID-19 crisis. Parents and caregivers are invited to call 833-258-5011 and/or visit www.talkitoutct.com to speak with trained professionals (in both English and Spanish) who will listen and discuss their concerns and, if additional help is needed, refer them to responsive services. The "Talk It Out Line" is available Monday-Friday from 8am to 8pm; and on weekends from 1 pm to 8 pm.
shared_text:
TALKITOUTCT.COM
When it builds up, talk it out

Parents and caregivers are invited to call 833-258-5011 and/or visit www.talkitoutct.com to speak with trained professionals (in both English and Spanish) who will listen and discuss their concerns and, if additional help is needed, refer them to responsive services. shared_text:
Hebron Public Schools PTA
April 28 at 3:03 PM ¬∑

* Email sent from Dr. Baird. This could be incorporated into a great lesson for the kids. We've included some cute examples to use for a card, craft or email to show your appreciation *

Good Morning Hebron Families,

Friday, May 1st is School Lunch Hero Day! Our Food Services Team have certainly been HEROES! They have been preparing, packaging and providing breakfast and lunch to over 800 children daily. Rain or shine, they have been keeping our children fed Sunday through Saturday.

I am hoping that many of our students will show their appreciation to our Lunch Heroes by sending a message to: eastconnfoodservice@eastconn.org Follow this link for some great ideas and templates. https://schoolnutrition.org/uploadedFiles/2_Meetings_and_Events/SLHD/LL01_SuperheroDay_all_3.11.pdf.

Please be sure to include your name and school on the messages sent and THANK YOU for letting these dedicated people know you are thinking of them on this special day.

Stay Well.

Best,

Thomas J. Baird, Ed.D
text:
Hebron Public Schools PTA
April 28 at 3:03 PM ¬∑

Good Morning Hebron Families,

Friday, May 1st is School Lunch Hero Day! Our Food Services Team have certainly been HEROES! They have been preparing, packaging and providing breakfast and lunch to over 800 children daily. Rain or shine, they have been keeping our children fed Sunday through Saturday.

I am hoping that many of our students will show their appreciation to our Lunch Heroes by sending a message to: eastconnfoodservice@eastconn.org Follow this link for some great ideas and templates. https://schoolnutrition.org/uploadedFiles/2_Meetings_and_Events/SLHD/LL01_SuperheroDay_all_3.11.pdf.

Please be sure to include your name and school on the messages sent and THANK YOU for letting these dedicated people know you are thinking of them on this special day.

Stay Well.

Best,

Thomas J. Baird, Ed.D

shared_text:
AHM Family Resource Center is at Gilead Hill School.
April 16 at 8:53 AM ¬∑ Hebron, CT ¬∑

Today is Artsy Thursday! In Play & Learn, we plan art activities for each group to make sure children can tap into their creative side. Art helps little ones learn to live in the moment, make choices, use their imaginations, express themselves, and explore different materials. And, they learn to take pride in their own accomplishments! Riley here made a beautiful watercolor painting, look at all those colors! It doesn‚Äôt always matter what projects you do, as long as you make it a meaningful experience. For some tips on this, check out: https://www.naeyc.org/our-work/families/meaningful-art-projects-parents-can-fit-busy-day
#ArtsyThursday #WOYC20 #NAEYC
Andover Hebron Marlborough Youth Services

post_text: We are back to our regular Monday, Wednesday, and Friday meal service next week (April 13th). Did you know that our Gilead Hill School site has now been established as a community-wide site? This means our meals are for all children age 18 and under and you don't need to be a resident of Hebron or a Hebron Public Schools family to participate. We are part of a state-wide program. This service is for everyone! Free meals regardless of financial hardship. If this meal service makes your life easier during this challenging time, please come and participate. If you can't make it, please have someone you know pick up food for you. We are happy to provide this service. https://drive.google.com/file/d/115FxeSowBif5ZFw22xBLqE6RaDtBx-0O/view?usp=sharing

post_text: Today we delivered over 100 devices to families to help learning continue at home during our closure! A big thanks to our tech team and DATTCO for making this happen. If you requested a device and we missed you, we will reach out to you directly.

post_text: Check out this Social Emotional Learning resource from our partner Andover Hebron Marlborough Youth Services!
shared_text:
Andover Hebron Marlborough Youth Services
March 19 at 1:33 PM ¬∑

As we all practice social distancing in order to decrease the spread of the Corona-virus, AHM will be sharing resources to help youth and family stay engaged, connected and supported. Our hope is that by taking this time apart from each other to keep our communities safe, we will eventually come together stronger!

FREE GIZMO‚Äôs GUIDE TO MENTAL HEALTH books are now available at our two drive-up Little Libraries located at our AHM Office (25 Pendleton Drive, Hebron) and The Gilead Hill Elementary School. For supplementary materials that go along with the book go to www.gizmo4mentalhealth.org/forkids/
